alert.note: Alert for Howell; Oregon; Ozark; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 8:56PM CST until January 15 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Howell, Oregon, Ozark, and Taney Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely continue to be slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear layered clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Call 1-888-275-6636 for road conditions.
